sen.j: 安部井櫟堂（あべい れきどう、男性、文化 (元号)2年（1805年） – 明治16年（1883年）9月16日）は、近代日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Rekido ABEI (male, 1805-September 16, 1883) was a modern Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).
Rekido ABEI (male, 1805-September 16, 1883) was a modern Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).
Rekido ABEI (male, 1805-September 16, 1883) was a modern Japanese tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).

sen.j: 名はカイ？（大+介）、字は大介、号 (称号)は芥舟。
sen.e: His name was Kai? (大+介), azana (adult male's nickname) was Daisuke, and second name or alias was Kaishu.
His name was Kai? (大+介), his azana (adult male's nickname) was Daisuke, and his pseudonym was Kaishu.
sen.cmt: hisを挿入、号を pseudonymとしました。
sen.e: His name was Kai? (大+介), his azana (adult male's nickname) was Daisuke, and his pseudonym was Kaishu.
Common name was Onto (音門), later Onto (音人).
His popular name was Onto (音門), later Onto (音人).
sen.cmt: 通称の表現変更しました。
sen.e: His popular name was Onto (音門), later Onto (音人).
His original family name was Oka.
His original family name was Oka.
His original family name was Oka.
He is from Hikone City, Omi Province.
He was from Hikone City, Omi Province.
He was from Hikone City, Omi Province.

sen.j: 近江に生まれたが京都富小路通押小路北・南に住む。
sen.e: Born in Omi Province and lived in Oshinokoji Street Kina and Minami, Tominokoji Street, Kyoto.
Born in Omi Province and lived in Oshinokoji Street Kita and Minami, Tominokoji Street, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ミススペル訂正しました。
sen.e: Born in Omi Province and lived in Oshinokoji Street Kita and Minami, Tominokoji Street, Kyoto.
His master in seal engraving is unknown.
His master in seal engraving is unknown.
His master in seal engraving is unknown.

sen.j: 明治元年に印司に任命される。
sen.e: In 1868, he was appointed as in no tsukasa.
In 1868, he was appointed as In no tsukasa.
sen.cmt: 混乱を避けるため、大文字化しました。
sen.e: In 1868, he was appointed as In no tsukasa.

sen.j: 60代半ばにして明治政府から天皇御璽・国璽の刻印を命じられた。
sen.e: He was ordered to carve a seal of the emperor and a seal of state by the Meiji Government when he was in his mid-sixties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was ordered to carve a seal of the emperor and a seal of state by the Meiji Government when he was in his mid-sixties.
He was ordered to carve a seal of the emperor and a seal of state by the Meiji Government when he was in his mid-sixties.

sen.j: 1年がかりで明治7年に拝刻した。
sen.e: He spent one year carving those seals and offered them to the government in 1874.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He spent one year carving those seals and offered them to the government in 1874.
He spent one year carving those seals and offered them to the government in 1874.

sen.j: この2つの金印は強度を保つために合金製である。
sen.e: These two gold seals were made by mixed metal to maintain the strength.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These two gold seals were made of an alloy to maintain the strength.
sen.cmt: 合金を変更、接続詞変更しました。
sen.e: These two gold seals were made of an alloy to maintain the strength.

sen.j: 櫟堂が繆篆を用いて原印を刻して秦藏六が金で鋳造した。
sen.e: He used byuten to carve the original seal and Zoroku HATA casted with gold.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「原印」の意味が不明です。
sen.e: He used byuten to carve the original seal and Zoroku HATA casted in gold.
He used byuten to carve the original seal and Zoroku HATA casted in gold.
It weighs 4.5 kg.
It weighs 4.5 kg.
It weighs 4.5 kg.
